com.google.code.sagetvaddons.sjq.server
Class DataStore

java.lang.Object
  com.google.code.sagetvaddons.sjq.server.DataStore

public final class DataStore
extends java.lang.Object

The SJQv4 DataStore houses the task queue, task client info, and task logs

Version:
$Id: DataStore.java 1176 2010-10-30 21:01:57Z derek@battams.ca $
Author:
dbattams

Method Summary

          Close the connection to the DataStore; once closed you must call DataStore.get() to get a new connection as this one will become invalid and will no longer function.

Method Detail

get

public static final DataStore get()

Get a valid, initiated connection to the SJQv4 DataStore.

The returned DataStore instance is automatically connected to the appropriate SageTV server regardless of whether this is invoked on the server or a PC client. If called outside of a SageTV JVM then it is assumed that your sagex-api RMI provider has been appropriately configured to the SageTV server.

Returns:
The DataStore connection or null in case of error

finalize

protected void finalize()
Extend the finalizer to also close the database connection

Overrides:
finalize in class java.lang.Object

isValid

public boolean isValid()

Determine if this data store connection is still in a valid state (i.e. it's still connected to the database server)

If isValid() returns false then the data store connection is removed from the thread local storage such that the next call to get() will return a new, freshly initiated data store connection for use.

Returns:
True if the connection is still valid or false otherwise

getSchema

public int getSchema()
Get the current schema version for the database.

Returns:
The current schema version; -1 is returned if the schema is not set (i.e. a new DB file)

getActiveQueue

public QueuedTask[] getActiveQueue()

Return an array of active tasks.

Active tasks are tasks that are assigned to a client and are running or tasks that are waiting to be assigned.

Returns:
An array of QueuedTasks representing all tasks in the queue that are running or waiting to be assigned to a client

getQueue

public QueuedTask[] getQueue()

Return an array of every task in the queue.

This method returns every task in the queue at the time of the call; this includes active tasks, completed tasks, and failed tasks. This list can get rather large, rather quickly!

Returns:
An array of QueuedTasks representing all tasks in the queue

logOutput

public boolean logOutput(QueuedTask qt,
                         java.lang.String type,
                         java.lang.String log)
Log task output to the database

Parameters:
qt - The task the log data is to be associated with
type - The type of log output ('TASK' or 'TEST')
log - The log contents to be stored
Returns:
True if the log output was saved successfully or false otherwise

saveClient

public boolean saveClient(Client clnt)
Create a new Client or update an existing one; use this method to register new task clients with the server

Parameters:
clnt - The client to be created or updated
Returns:
True if the Client was saved/updated or false otherwise

getClient

public Client getClient(java.lang.String host,
                        int port)
Retrieve a Client instance for the given host/port combination

Parameters:
host - The hostname of the Client to retrieve
port - The port number for the Client
Returns:
The Client, if it's registered, or null if the given Client does not exist in the database

getAllClients

public Client[] getAllClients()
Get an array of all registered task clients

Returns:
The array of all registered task clients

getMetadata

public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> getMetadata(long id)
Get the metadata map for the given task queue id

Parameters:
id - The unique task queue id to build the map for
Returns:
A map of metadata for the given task id; may be an empty map, but never null

getSetting

public java.lang.String getSetting(java.lang.String var)
Retrive a setting from the SJQv4 registry

Parameters:
var - The name of the setting to retrieve
Returns:
The value of the setting or null if the setting does not exist in the registry
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if var = 'schema'; you cannot read the schema this way; use getSchema() instead

getSetting

public java.lang.String getSetting(java.lang.String var,
                                   java.lang.String defaultVal)
Retrieve a setting from the SJQv4 registry

Parameters:
var - The name of the setting to retrieve
defaultVal - The default value to return if the setting does not exist in the registry
Returns:
The value of the setting or defaultVal if the setting does not exist
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if var = 'schema'; you cannot read the schema this way; use getSchema() instead

setSetting

public void setSetting(java.lang.String var,
                       java.lang.String val)
Save a setting to the SJQv4 registry

Parameters:
var - The name of the setting
val - The value of the setting
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if var = 'schema'; you cannot manipulate the schema value of the database

close

public void close()
Close the connection to the DataStore; once closed you must call DataStore.get() to get a new connection as this one will become invalid and will no longer function.

getRegisteredTaskIds

public java.lang.String[] getRegisteredTaskIds()
Get a list of all registered task ids from all registered task clients

Returns:
The list of task ids; may be empty in case of error, but never null

getAllRegisteredTasks

public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.util.Collection<Task>> getAllRegisteredTasks()

Get a map of all registered tasks

Each key of the map is a Client.getDescription() value for the client the task belongs to

Returns:
The map of registered tasks; may be empty in case of error, but never null

getActiveTasksForClient

public QueuedTask[] getActiveTasksForClient(Client clnt)
Get an array of tasks currently running on the given Client

Parameters:
clnt - The client to get active tasks for
Returns:
An array of tasks actively running on the given Client
